read_all_text.label: Read ALL chat
read_all_text.tooltip:
Check this to read all chat disregarding the command.
IF YOU ARE USING THIS FEATURE MAKE SURE TO SET A FAST SPEED SO THE CHATBOT CAN KEEP UP!

tts_case.label: Force lower or upper case
tts_case.tooltip: Set this if you want TTS to read lowercase (could avoid acronyms on uppercase words) or uppercase (could read words as acronym).

tts_clean_repeated_letters.label: Clean repeated letters
tts_clean_repeated_letters.tooltip:
Prevent repeated letters to be spoken and only speak them twice.
Example: noooooooo -> noo.

tts_clean_repeated_words.label: Clean repeated words/emotes
tts_clean_repeated_words.tooltip:
Prevent repeated words/emotes to be spoken and only speak them as max as setted below.
Example: :Kappa: :Kappa: :Kappa: :Kappa: :Kappa: :Kappa: -> :Kappa:

tts_max_repeated_words.label: Max words/emotes repeat allowed
tts_max_repeated_words.tooltip: How many times you allow to repeat a word/emote.

tts_clean_urls.label: Clean links
tts_clean_urls.tooltip: Prevent links to be spoken and say the replacement text instead

tts_replacement_urls.label: Replace links with
tts_replacement_urls.tooltip: If Clean links is checked, the links will be replaced with this text

say_username.label: Say username before message
say_username.tooltip: Check this to say the username before the message

say_after_username.label: Say this after the username
say_after_username.tooltip: Append this text to the username so the TTS makes more sense

ignore_starting_with.label: Ignore messages starting with
ignore_starting_with.tooltip: Ignore messages starting with any of these characters to prevent commands being spoken

tts_replaces.label: Replace these with spaces
tts_replaces.tooltip: For each character in here, replaces each occurrence of it with a white space, so TTS will not read them literally.

tts_emote_name_first_is_upper.label: First emotes' name letter is uppercase, after prefix
tts_emote_name_first_is_upper.tooltip:
Check this if the first letter of your emotes' name (the first letter after your channel prefix) is uppercased.
Checking this flag could help next option (Emote prefix, don't read this) to not be too invasive and to create less oddities.

tts_emote_prefix.label: Emote prefix, don't read this
tts_emote_prefix.tooltip:
If you want to read your own channel emotes name as words and skip prefix, specify it here.
Be sure it is not a common char sequence used in your TTS, otherwise it would became mute at any occurrence, also outside emotes' name. It is case sensitive.
Setting the other option (First emotes' name letter is uppercase) could help.
Left empty if you don't want to use this option.

tts_alias_list.label: Alias to apply to words or nicknames
tts_alias_list.tooltip:
You can set aliases for words or nicknames (only full words, no partials), if you want them to be spelled differently. Expressed with 'Word:Alias' or 'Name:Alias' couples separated by semicolon.
Note1: It also applies on 'Say username' option. 
Note2: Blacklist checks will be made on original nicknames.

tts_chars_swapping.label: Character series to swap
tts_chars_swapping.tooltip:
Swaps series of characters with another series, if you want them to be spelled differently. Expressed with 'Chars:Swaps' couples separated by semicolon.
Note: at the contrary of aliases, as for the option above, this option is case sensitive but swaps also partial words, so it could be invasive and create oddities. Be sure to use the most rich series of characters possible.

tts_cut_max_chars.label: Cut automatically to Max chars allowed
tts_cut_max_chars.tooltip:
Check this to let the system automatically cut text to max characters allowed, to be able to play TTS.
Otherwise the text will not be read if too long (silently ignored).

tts_max_chars.label: Max chars allowed
tts_max_chars.tooltip: Max characters allowed to submit to TTS.

command.label: Command
command.tooltip: Command for users to say something with TTS.

permission.label: Permission level
permission.tooltip: Set the permission level for the command.

do_msg_missing_text.label: Missing text
do_msg_missing_text.tooltip: Check this to shown a message when someone tries to issue the command without a text to be read.

msg_missing_text.value: You need to specify a message.
msg_missing_text.label: Missing text message
msg_missing_text.tooltip: Message shown when someone tries to issue the command without a text to be read.

do_msg_permission.label: Permissions
do_msg_permission.tooltip: Check this to shown a message when someone tries to issue the command without enough permissions.

msg_permission.value: You don't have enough permissions to use this command.
msg_permission.label: Permissions message
msg_permission.tooltip: Message shown when someone tries to issue the command without enough permissions.

do_msg_cooldown.label: Cooldown
do_msg_cooldown.tooltip: Check this to shown a message when someone tries to issue the command but it is still on cooldown.

msg_cooldown.value: This command is still on cooldown!
msg_cooldown.label: Cooldown message
msg_cooldown.tooltip: Message shown when someone tries to issue the command but it is still on cooldown.

do_msg_user_cooldown.label: User Cooldown
do_msg_user_cooldown.tooltip: Check this to shown a message when someone tries to issue the command while they are on cooldown.

msg_user_cooldown.value: You need to wait before using this command again.
msg_user_cooldown.label: User Cooldown message
msg_user_cooldown.tooltip: Message shown when someone tries to issue the command while they are on cooldown.

do_msg_cost.label: Cost
do_msg_cost.tooltip: Check this to shown a message when someone tries to issue the command without enough points.

msg_cost.value: You don't have enough money to use this command.
msg_cost.label: Cost message
msg_cost.tooltip: Message shown when someone tries to issue the command without enough points.

do_msg_too_long.label: Too long
do_msg_too_long.tooltip: Check this to shown a message when someone tries to issue the command with a message too long.

msg_too_long.label: Too long message
msg_too_long.tooltip: Message shown when someone tries to issue the command with a message too long. {0} is where user's nickname will go.

do_msg_blacklisted.label: Blacklisted
do_msg_blacklisted.tooltip: Check this to shown a message when someone banned tries to issue a command.

msg_blacklisted.label: Blacklisted message
msg_blacklisted.tooltip: Message shown when someone banned tries to issue a command. {0} is where user's nickname will go.

cmd_skip.label: Skip currently playing text command
cmd_skip.tooltip:
Use this command to skip the currently playing text in case of a troll.
You can even skip all texts in queue containing a reference word, if any word is specified after the command.

cmd_skipnext.label: Skip next text command in queue, without need the current one ends up.
cmd_skipnext.tooltip: Use this command to skip the next text queue, in case of a troll, without need to wait the current one ends up.

cmd_skipall.label: Skip the whole text command queue, and start a new one.
cmd_skipall.tooltip: Use this command to skip the whole texts queue, for any reason, like going to close the session.

cmd_ban.label: Add user to blacklist command
cmd_ban.tooltip: Use this command to add an user to the blacklist

cmd_unban.label: Remove user from blacklist command
cmd_unban.tooltip: Use this command to remove an user from the blacklist

moderator_permission.label: Moderator permission
moderator_permission.tooltip: Allow these users to blacklist/unblacklist people

mod_bannable.label: Allow bannable moderators
mod_bannable.tooltip: Check this to make moderators bannable from using Moderator commands.

do_msg_missing_target.label: Missing target
do_msg_missing_target.tooltip: Check this to shown when moderator forget to specify the target user.

msg_missing_target.label: Missing target message
msg_missing_target.tooltip: Message shown when moderator forget to specify the target user. {0} is where the command will go.

do_msg_blacklisted_success.label: Successfully blacklisted
do_msg_blacklisted_success.tooltip: Check this to shown when moderator succeed to ban an user.

msg_blacklisted_success.label: Successfully blacklisted message
msg_blacklisted_success.tooltip: Message shown when moderator succeed to ban an user. {0} is where user's nickname will go.

do_msg_blacklisted_unsuccess.label: Unsuccessfully blacklisted
do_msg_blacklisted_unsuccess.tooltip: Check this to shown when moderator tries to ban an already banned user.

msg_blacklisted_unsuccess.label: Unsuccessfully blacklisted message
msg_blacklisted_unsuccess.tooltip: Message shown when moderator tries to ban an already banned user. {0} is where user's nickname will go.

do_msg_unbanned_success.label: Successfully unbanned
do_msg_unbanned_success.tooltip: Check this to shown when moderator succeed to unban an user.

msg_unbanned_success.label: Successfully unbanned message
msg_unbanned_success.tooltip: Message shown when moderator succeed to unban an user. {0} is where user's nickname will go.

do_msg_unbanned_unsuccess.label: Unsuccessfully unbanned
do_msg_unbanned_unsuccess.tooltip: Check this to shown when moderator tries to ban a not banned user.

msg_unbanned_unsuccess.label: Unsuccessfully unbanned message
msg_unbanned_unsuccess.tooltip: Message shown when moderator tries to unban a not banned user. {0} is where user's nickname will go.

tts_volume_on.label: Alter volume?
tts_volume_on.tooltip: Alter volume of TTS generated file?

tts_pitch_on.label: Alter pitch?
tts_pitch_on.tooltip:
Alter pitch of TTS generated file?
Note: Pitch will still influece speed final effect, if alter speed is enabled.

tts_speed_on.label: Alter speed?
tts_speed_on.tooltip:
Alter speed of TTS generated file?
Note: Pitch value will also be involted, even if alter pitch is disabled.

tts_length.label: Max length (seconds)
tts_length.tooltip: Limit the duration the TTS will be speaking.

tts_confirm.label: Settings update confirmation
tts_confirm.tooltip: TTS will say this sentence to confirm settings are updated successfully.

tts_params.label: Custom parameters
tts_params.tooltip:
These parameters will fill the webservice call, replacing in order {2}, {3} and so on.
They have to be enclosed in quotation marks.
{0} and {1} are not included because they'll be {0} = text to read and {1} = lang.
If your webservice lang format is different than default (i.e not: 'en-GB', 'fil-PH', 'it-IT') you can set it as custom parameter.

tts_webservice.label: Webservice
tts_webservice.tooltip: The webservice to be called for TTS services. {0}, {1} and so on will be replaced by parameters, in order, as for previous field.

tts_audio_format.label: Audio format
tts_audio_format.tooltip: Audio file extention generated by TTS service.
